item.title: 劳埃德称英国企业对预算案后的复苏充满信心
item.description: 在上个月的预算案中，英国企业免去了税收方面的大部分痛苦，因此他们在 2025 年底对经济前景感到更加乐观。【原文：UK businesses ended 2025 feeling more upbeat about the economy’s prospects after they were spared much of the tax pain at last month’s budget.】

item.title: 巴伦西亚在初选前加入哥伦比亚中右翼联盟
item.description: 据参议员帕洛玛-巴伦西亚（Paloma Valencia）所在政党的一位资深议员称，她赢得了哥伦比亚强大的中央民主党的提名，并将加入一个由中右翼其他候选人组成的联盟，该联盟将于 3 月举行初选。【原文：Senator Paloma Valencia, who won the nomination for Colombia’s powerful Centro Democrático party, is joining an alliance of other hopefuls from the center and right which will hold a primary in March, according to a senior lawmaker from her party.】

item.title: 黄金因降息押注和风险而创下今年第 50 个日记录
item.description: 周二，黄金升至历史新高；这是黄金今年以来第50天刷新纪录；投资者权衡了不断升级的地缘政治紧张局势和美国进一步降息的前景。【原文：Gold rose to an all-time high on Tuesday — the 50th day it’s broken records this year — as investors weighed escalating geopolitical tensions and the prospects for more US rate cuts.】

item.title: 关注美国对委内瑞拉的封锁，石油维持四天涨势
item.description: 由于美国继续封锁委内瑞拉的原油运输，石油在连续四天上涨后持稳。【原文：Oil was steady after a four-day run of gains as the US continued its blockade of shipments of crude from Venezuela.】

item.title: Asian Stocks Poised to Extend Record Global Rally: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia were primed for a mainly positive open after bullish momentum lifted shares on Wall Street. Oil and gold rallied as the dollar fell.

item.title: Fitch Lifts Ukraine Rating to CCC After Warrant Conversion
item.description: Fitch Ratings lifted Ukraine’s score from selective default after the nation announced creditors agreed to an exchange of its growth-linked debt into conventional bonds.

item.title: Electronic Arts Shareholders Approve $55 Billion Sale to Saudis
item.description: Electronic Arts Inc. shareholders approved the $55 billion sale of the company, a leading video-game publisher, in a deal led by Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund.

item.title: Saks Mulls Bankruptcy Year After Raising Billions for Turnaround
item.description: Saks Global Enterprises, facing limited options ahead of a more than $100 million debt payment due at the end of this month, is considering Chapter 11 bankruptcy as a last resort, according to people with knowledge of the situation.

item.title: CPP, Goodman to Invest $2.6 Billion in European Data Centers
item.description: The Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Australia’s Goodman Group agreed to set up a multibillion dollar European data center business, as the rise of artificial intelligence drives demand for power and storage sites.

item.title: Stock Surge, Currency Gains Fuel 2026 Investor Optimism for Asia
item.description: Asia is back on top. The region’s stock markets have beaten the US and Europe this year, credit markets are strong, currencies are strengthening, and investors expect the momentum to carry into 2026.

item.title: Lease-to-Own Firm FlexShopper Files Bankruptcy After Firing CEO
item.description: FlexShopper Inc., a publicly traded provider of lease-to-own financing for appliances, electronics and other consumer products, filed for bankruptcy months after firing its chief executive officer following an internal investigation into fraudulent loan documents.

item.title: 恒天然称新西兰-印度贸易协定在乳制品准入方面令人失望
item.description: 乳业巨头恒天然合作社集团（Fonterra Co-operative Group）表示，新西兰与印度的自由贸易协定几乎没有为该行业提供有意义的准入，尽管其他行业对周一敲定的协议表示欢迎。【原文：Dairy giant Fonterra Co-operative Group said New Zealand’s free trade agreement with India delivered little in the way of meaningful access for the industry even as other sectors welcomed the deal finalized Monday.】

item.title: Nvidia’s Biggest Southeast Asian Partner Dogged by China Chip Smuggling Questions
item.description: Singapore-based Megaspeed has imported tens of thousands more chips than Nvidia saw when checking its data centers.

item.title: CFPB to Be Crippled by Trump Funding Freeze, States’ Suit Says
item.description: The Trump administration is illegally trying to cripple the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau by refusing to ask the Federal Reserve for funds needed to run the independent regulator, a group of mostly Democratic-led states said in a federal lawsuit.

item.title: Troilus in Talks on German Funding for Quebec Gold-Copper Mine
item.description: The German government is in talks with Canadian firm Troilus Mining Corp. to fund investment in a large mining project, helping secure copper supplies that are key to the energy transition.

item.title: Thiel-Backed Crypto Hoarder ETHZilla Sells Tokens to Pay Debt
item.description: ETHZilla Corp., a cryptocurrency accumulator backed by billionaire Peter Thiel, appears to be shifting focus as investors abandon what was briefly one of the stock market’s hottest trades.

item.title: USDA Lost a Third of Its DC Staff Even Before Relocation Effort
item.description: About a third of the US Department of Agriculture’s employees in the Washington area left the agency from January to June, as the Trump administration sought to aggressively trim what it sees as excessive government spending.

item.title: Argentina’s Economy Grew Less Than Expected Before Midterms
item.description: Argentina’s economy grew less than expected in October in the face of a market selloff just before October midterm elections.

item.title: NFL Chiefs Will Move to Kansas After Stadium Funding Is Approved
item.description: The Kansas City Chiefs are planning to announce that they are moving across the Missouri border to Kansas after lawmakers there approved a public financing package to build a new stadium, according to people familiar with the team’s plans.

item.title: Coinbase Acquires The Clearing Company in Prediction Market Push
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc. announced Monday that it will acquire a derivatives clearinghouse, The Clearing Company, to boost its entry into the growing prediction markets business.

item.title: Paraguay Holds Key Rate at 6%, Sees Inflation on Target in 2026
item.description: Paraguay’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate steady at 6%, reiterating that inflation will converge with its target in 2026.

item.title: JPMorgan Joins AQR, Two Sigma in Launching ‘Tax-Aware’ Strategy
item.description: JPMorgan Asset Management is tapping into a booming market for wealthy investors with the launch of a private fund designed to maximize after-tax returns by generating losses.

item.title: FanDuel Launches Latest Prediction Markets App, Chasing Rivals
item.description: FanDuel, the US online gambling division of Flutter Entertainment Plc, launched its own prediction market product in five states just days after its main rival, DraftKings Inc., rolled out a similar product.

item.title: Bond Traders’ Big Bet Targets US 10-Year Back to 4% Within Weeks
item.description: Traders are loading up on Treasury options targeting a bond rally that would send US 10-year yields back to 4% in coming weeks, a level not seen since the end of November.

item.title: CEO of Boeing and Lockheed Rocket Joint Venture ULA Resigns
item.description: Tory Bruno, the chief executive officer of Boeing Co. and Lockheed Martin Corp.’s rocket joint venture United Launch Alliance, has resigned after serving in the position for nearly 12 years.

item.title: Thiel-Backed Bank Set to Double Valuation to $4.35 Billion
item.description: A Silicon Valley-focused banking startup backed by Palantir Technologies Inc. co-founder Peter Thiel is expected to raise $350 million in a funding round that would more than double its valuation.

item.title: ECB’s Schnabel Doesn’t Expect Rate Hikes in Foreseeable Future
item.description: European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said she doesn’t expect interest rates to be lifted for some time.

item.title: Wheat, Soybeans Climb on Black Sea Port Attacks, Export Outlook
item.description: Wheat jumped as escalating tension between Russia and Ukraine sparked concerns over crop exports from the Black Sea region. Soybeans also rose.

item.title: One Chart That Helps Explain Surging Auto Delinquencies
item.description: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

item.title: Wells Fargo to Expand Into Clearing the $3.9 Trillion-a-Day Options Market
item.description: Wells Fargo & Co.’s global-markets business is expanding into options clearing, a capital intensive and operationally arduous corner of finance dominated by Bank of America Corp. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
